intro: Centaurea carthamoides, commonly known as the brownweed or redhead, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring wiry stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow or red flowers arranged in dense, conical clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas, roadsides, and waste places. Its adaptability and showy flowers make it a common weed in many regions.
